intro: Ruellia involucrata, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with opposite leaves that are often lance-shaped. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Ruellia involucrata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
